qas.question: How many computers were connected to the internet in 1988?
When was the first computer worm released?
Who was the first computer worm traced back to?
What is a malicious code that demands processor time and spreads itself to other computers?
Why did Morris Jr make the computer worm?

answers.text: he wanted to count how many machines were connected to the Internet

context: In 1988, only <a0_0><b10_0>60,000<b10_0/><a0_0/> computers were connected to the Internet, and most were <b5_0><b14_0>mainframes, minicomputers and professional workstations<b14_0/><b5_0/>. On <a1_0><b7_0><b12_0>November 2, 1988<b12_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>, many started to slow down, because they were running <b6_0>a malicious code<b6_0/> that demanded processor time and that spread itself to other computers – the first internet "<a3_0>computer worm<a3_0/>". The software was traced back to <b9_0>23-year-old<b9_0/> <b13_0>Cornell University<b13_0/> graduate student <a2_0><b8_0><b11_0>Robert Tappan Morris, Jr<b11_0/>.<b8_0/><a2_0/> who said '<a4_0>he wanted to count how many machines were connected to the Internet<a4_0/>'.
